attributes.action: Don't Close Places Of Worship throughout the lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: Places of worship have already been taking responsible precautions in terms of social distancing, wearing of masks and sanitation to prevent the spread of the virus therefore what is the evidence to suggest that private prayer in a place of worship is safe, Not being able to attend collective acts of worship will have a detrimental impact on the mental health and wellbeing of so many, the government is duty-bound to explain the justification behind this decision.

rejection.details:
Places of worship are able to remain open for independent prayer, funerals or funeral commemorative events, to broadcast an act of worship, to provide essential voluntary services or urgent public support services, for registered childcare, and to host permitted gatherings: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/new-national-restrictions-from-5-november

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Allow corporate worship and congregational singing at places of worship: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548621
